model

Class Goal

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Goal
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Precondition

    public class Goal
extends java.lang.Object
implements Precondition
    The goal is described by a set of requirements.

    Created by Daniel Riissanen on 3.4.2018.

    • Method Detail

      • setRequirements

        public void setRequirements(Precondition... requirements)

      • getDeficitCost

        public float getDeficitCost(State state)
        Description copied from interface: Precondition
        The method returns an integer describing how much the given state is lacking for it to fulfill the requirements described by the precondition.

        A deficit of 1, could mean that one requirement has not been fulfilled. But ultimately it is up to the developer themselves to decide what it means.

        Specified by:
        getDeficitCost in interface Precondition
        Parameters:
        state - The state to check against
        Returns:
        0 if the requirement has been fulfilled, otherwise an integer describing the deficit

      • isEqual

        public boolean isEqual(java.lang.Object other,
                       State state)
        Checks whether two goals are equal.
        Parameters:
        other - The other goal to check
        state - The state to check against
        Returns:
        true if the deficits of the two goals are the same, otherwise false
